name: Ackerman v. North Huntingdon Township (et al., Appellant)

judges: Before Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy and Barbieri, JJ.
Mr. Chief Justice Bell took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
parties: Ackerman v. North Huntingdon Township (et al., Appellant).

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Decree affirmed; costs on appellant.
Mr. Chief Justice Bell took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Harold A. Gold, with him Leonard Boreman, and Baskin, Boreman, Sachs, Gondelman & Graig, for appellant.
Joseph M. Loughran, with him Loughran & Lough-ran, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Ackerman v. North Huntingdon Township (et al., Appellant).
Argued March 22, 1971.
Before Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Roberts, Pomeroy and Barbieri, JJ.
Harold A. Gold, with him Leonard Boreman, and Baskin, Boreman, Sachs, Gondelman & Graig, for appellant.
Joseph M. Loughran, with him Loughran & Lough-ran, for appellee.
October 12, 1971:
